definition: Xishan district of Wuxi city 無錫市|无锡市[Wu2 xi1 shi4], Jiangsu
tin (chemistry)/to bestow/to confer/to grant/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
Xishan district of Wuxi city 無錫市|无锡市[Wu2 xi1 shi4], Jiangsu

sentences.english: LongKey has been listed by Wuxi Municipal as Xishan District "123" plan supporting enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 被无锡政府列为锡山区重点“123”计划支持企业。

sentences.english: After the overthrow of the Qing dynasty, Shanxi was held by warlord Yan Xishan.
sentences.chinese: 清朝被推翻后，山西被军阀阎锡山占领。

sentences.english: "Cong" people "-Chun Man", that is, "Yuzhou Man" and the "Liao" originated with "Pu" Family.
sentences.chinese: 阎锡山幕僚是民国时期一个重要的军人幕僚群体。

sentences.english: But Yan Hsi-shan was still like a trapped beast.
sentences.chinese: 但是，阎锡山仍然在作困兽之斗。

sentences.english: The old army refers to the troops under Yen Hsi-shan, the Kuomintang warlord in Shansi;
sentences.chinese: 旧军，指国民党山西地方实力派阎锡山指挥的晋绥军。

sentences.english: Xishan Qin's family which is one of the most representative of the typical cases during this period.
sentences.chinese: 其中锡山秦氏是极具代表性的典例之一。

sentences.english: One column was led by Yan Xishan, and against it we fought the Shangdang Campaign.
sentences.chinese: 一路是阎锡山，我们就手打了个上党战役。

sentences.english: This equally applies to the appraisal of Yan Xishan's localism.
sentences.chinese: 对阎锡山的地方主义的评价亦应如此。
